member.name: T:ToLogger.NotificationPriority
member.summary: Priority for notifications on Android 7.1 and lower

member.name: F:ToLogger.NotificationPriority.Min
member.summary: Lowest notification priority, these items might not be shown to the user except under special circumstances, such as detailed notification logs.

member.name: F:ToLogger.NotificationPriority.Low
member.summary: Lower notification priority, for items that are less important. The UI may choose to show these items smaller, or at a different position in the list, compared with your app's Default items.

member.name: F:ToLogger.NotificationPriority.Default
member.summary: If your application does not prioritize its own notifications, use this value for all notifications.

member.name: F:ToLogger.NotificationPriority.High
member.summary: Higher notification priority, for more important notifications or alerts. The UI may choose to show these items larger, or at a different position in notification lists, compared with your app's Default items.

member.name: F:ToLogger.NotificationPriority.Max
member.summary: Highest notification priority, for your application's most important items that require the user's prompt attention or input.

member.name: M:ToLogger.Platform.Droid.NotificationService.CreateNotificationChannel(Android.Content.Context,ToLogger.Platform.Droid.NotificationChannelRequest)
member.summary: Create Notification Channel when API >= 26. Ref : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29949501/android-show-notification-with-a-popup-on-top-of-any-application But remember that once you create the channel, you cannot change these settings and the user has final control of whether these behaviors are active. Other option is to uninstall and install application again
